results.title: Round up
results.brief_description: Round Up follows the journey of two country boys who find themselves out of place in the hustle and bustle of the big city. Here in this unfamiliar environment, they may learn that they are not as different as they first thought.
results.description: Round Up follows the journey of two country boys who find themselves out of place in the hustle and bustle of the big city. Here in this unfamiliar environment, they may learn that they are not as different as they first thought.
description_for_label: Round Up follows the journey of two country boys who find themselves out of place in the hustle and bustle of the big city. Here in this unfamiliar environment, they may learn that they are not as different as they first thought.
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Round the world by air
results.brief_description: A film record of the delivery flight of the first Convair Aircraft purchased by Trans-Australia Airlines. The aircraft travelled 18,000 miles in 72 hours on its round-the-world trip, passing over 25 countries on its flight from San Diego, USA, to Melbourne. Photography by Geoffrey Thompson.
results.description: A film record of the delivery flight of the first Convair Aircraft purchased by Trans-Australia Airlines. The aircraft travelled 18,000 miles in 72 hours on its round-the-world trip, passing over 25 countries on its flight from San Diego, USA, to Melbourne. Photography by Geoffrey Thompson.

results.title: Round the twist: Wunderpants
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: When Pete dries his underpants in the microwave, special powers are conveyed with embarrassing consequences. But when Pete’s frog competes in the jumping competition, the wunderpants save the day.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Jennings, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Round the twist: without my pants
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Pete is inflicted with a bizarre speech defect. He compulsively adds the words “without my pants” to the end of every sentence with hilarious and embarrassing results.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Jennings, Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Round the twist: the gum-leaf war
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Dreaming that she has a huge nose, Linda takes her problems to Aunt Tuneless’ shack in the mountains where a war is in progress. People can inflict their own ailments on others by playing the gum leaves from a twisted tree.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Jennings, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Mark Lewis, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation

results.title: Round the twist: the cabbage patch fib
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Believing that babies grow in the cabbage patch, Bronson actually finds one there. But he soon discovers that the responsibilities of parenthood have their drawbacks.

constellations_other.name: Cautionary tales and magic lantern projectors
constellations_other.description: Early magic lantern projections depicted cautionary religious scenes and fairytales, just like cinema did in its infancy.

results.title: Round the twist: spaghetti pig out
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Chaos reigns after a bolt of lightning hits the video remote control - it works on people! Pause, rewind and fast-forward have amusing consequences, particularly at the spaghetti eating competition.

results.title: Round the twist: skeleton on the dunny
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: When the Twists move from the city to live in an old lighthouse, they discover that the outside dunny is haunted. One stormy night they decide to have a showdown with a very flushed ghost.

results.title: Round the twist: Santa Claws
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Mark Lewis, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Pete’s dream comes true when he meets Santa Claws Number 115,302 who grants each member of the Twist family two wishes, something they all end up wishing had never happened.
